item.text: Then God said to Jacob, “Go up at once to Bethel and live there. Make an altar there to God, who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”

So <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> his <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him, “<st data-num="05493" class="">Get rid of</st> the <st data-num="05236" class="">foreign</st> <st data-num="0430 0834">gods</st> you have <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> you.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02891" class="">Purify</st> yourselves and <st data-num="02498" class="">change</st> your <st data-num="08071" class="">clothes</st>.<n id="2" />
Let us go up at once to Bethel. Then I will make an altar there to God, who responded to me in my time of distress and has been with me wherever I went.”
So they gave Jacob all the foreign gods that were in their possession and the rings that were in their ears. Jacob buried them under the oak near Shechem
and they started on their journey. The surrounding cities were afraid of God, and they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
Jacob and all those who were with him arrived at Luz (that is, Bethel) in the land of Canaan.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> an <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">named</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0410" class="">El</st> <st data-num="01008" class="">Bethel</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> had <st data-num="01540" class="">revealed</st> himself<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him when he was <st data-num="01272" class="">fleeing</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st>.
(Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died and was buried under the oak below Bethel; thus it was named Oak of Weeping.)
God appeared to Jacob again after he returned from Paddan Aram and blessed him.

<st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “Your <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> is <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>, <st data-num="03588 0518">but</st> your <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">longer</st> be <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st>; <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> your <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st>.” So God <st data-num="07121 08034">named</st> him <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="1" />

Then <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> am the <st data-num="07706" class="">Sovereign</st> <st data-num="0410" class="">God</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06509" class="">Be fruitful</st> and <st data-num="07235" class="">multiply</st>! A <st data-num="01471" class="">nation</st>—even a <st data-num="06951" class="">company</st> of <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st>—will <st data-num="01961" class="">descend</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> you; <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> will <st data-num="03318" class="">be</st> among your <st data-num="02504" class="">descendants</st>!<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="0776 0834">land</st> I <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> and <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st> I will <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> to you. To your <st data-num="02233 0310">descendants</st><n id="2" /> I will also <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> this <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.”

Then <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">went up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> he <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him.

So <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="05324" class="">set up</st> a <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred</st> <st data-num="068" class="">stone</st> <st data-num="04678" class="">pillar</st> in the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> God <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="05258" class="">poured out</st> a <st data-num="05262" class="">drink offering</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it, and then he <st data-num="03332" class="">poured</st> <st data-num="08081" class="">oil</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it.<n id="2" />
Jacob named the place where God spoke with him Bethel.
They traveled on from Bethel, and when Ephrath was still some distance away, Rachel went into labor—and her labor was hard.

When her <st data-num="03205" class="">labor</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> at its <st data-num="07185" class="">hardest</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03205" class="">midwife</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to her, “<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> you are having <st data-num="01571 02088">another</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01961" class="">With</st> her <st data-num="03588 04191">dying</st> <st data-num="03318 05315">breath</st>,<n id="1" /> she <st data-num="07121 08034">named</st> him <st data-num="01126" class="">Ben Oni</st>.<n id="2" /> But his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> him <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st> instead.<n id="3" />

So <st data-num="07354" class="">Rachel</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st> and was <st data-num="06912" class="">buried</st> on the <st data-num="01870" class="">way</st> to <st data-num="0672" class="">Ephrath</st> (<st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> is, <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st>).<n id="1" />
Jacob set up a marker over her grave; it is the Marker of Rachel’s Grave to this day.
Then Israel traveled on and pitched his tent beyond Migdal Eder.

While Israel was living in that land, Reuben went to bed with Bilhah, his father’s concubine, and Israel heard about it.

Jacob had twelve sons:
The sons of Leah were Reuben, Jacob’s firstborn, as well as Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
The sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
The sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s servant, were Dan and Naphtali.

The sons of Zilpah, Leah’s servant, were Gad and Asher.

These were the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan Aram.
So Jacob came back to his father Isaac in Mamre, to Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had stayed.

<st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">lived</st> to be <st data-num="03967 08084">180</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">old</st>.<n id="1" />
Then Isaac breathed his last and joined his ancestors. He died an old man who had lived a full life. His sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
